Description: The image appears to be a diagram illustrating the term "frontal carina." It shows a simplified anatomical representation, likely focusing on specific features between the frontal area and toruli, with arrows indicating areas of interest. The accompanying text describes the frontal carina as a longitudinal ridge or pair of ridges located on the frons.

The image features a diagram and text explaining the term "gena," which refers to the lateral part of the head in certain organisms, particularly in relation to the structure around the compound eye. The illustration shows two head profiles, likely pertaining to insects, highlighting different aspects of the gena in various head orientations (hypognathous and prognathous). The accompanying description elaborates on its location and function.

The image depicts a diagram of a torulus, which is defined as a paired socket on the front of an insect's head where the scape (the base of the antenna) articulates. The illustration shows the toruli with arrows pointing to them, indicating their location, and includes labeled anatomical features of the head.
